Shakespeare's a

And he comes in,

to really automatethis experimental
psychology, and he inventedwhat's called a Skinner box.But it's just a soundproof,

And nobody even has any good

attention for 20 years.Have you heard of anybody
discovering anythingabout dolphins except
they're very good at solvinga lot of physical problems?Anyway, that's-- I'm bothered
by the mystery of why was theresome psychology in
Aristotle's time?And why didn't it get
anywhere till 1950,when there was

who made up things,

like Maxwell's equations for how
animals learn, and there weregenerally three or four laws.And if there's a

in the sequence.They don't remember

and I startedthinking about these things,

And in his later
years, he startedcourting algebraic

and it was reallyexciting to meet the starter

because we started out as fish,

or lizards, or

isn't in the main lineand you were just unlucky

areas get destroyed,other parts take over.They almost never are as good.And mostly, many functions

and repairing.I think there was some idea that

one part in the 1,000.And so, in fact, you would

has enormous redundancy--well, now change

function is somewhat

supported in five different

sort of.And he had the mind
divided into three parts.At one end of the mind,
